Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying a deferential standard of review to the RPD's decision
Evidence_Assessment: Credibility of applicants' claims regarding persecution by ex-husband in Tunisia
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected claim, RAD initially upheld with deference
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish refugee status
Credibility_Factor: RPD found credibility issues with applicants' testimony
Legal_Rule: RAD must conduct a complete review of factual, legal, and mixed questions without undue deference to RPD
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of deferential standard by appellate body
Outcome_on_Merits: Initial denial of refugee status due to credibility concerns
Review_Standard: Complete review standard required for RAD
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deferral to RPD undermined fairness of appeal process
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicants' testimony on persecution, credibility findings
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination system, statutory role of RAD
Applicant_Challenge: RADâ€™s use of deferential standard contrary to statutory mandate
Court_Result: Decision partially overturned, remanded to new RAD panel
Outcome: Remanded for reconsideration by new RAD panel
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of RAD decision and order for redetermination
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative rehearing
Legal_Provision: Section 110 of IRPA regarding RAD appeals
Governing_Rule: RAD must apply correctness or de novo standard on appeal, not reasonableness
